page.title: 06FISHING IN WATERGATE BAY
page.content: On 3:7:85 we went deep sea fishing in Watergate Bay.At Newquay harbour we got on the boats,The Sunrise owned by John Lowe,which was 20ft long and took 9 passangers and "Sea Horse"owned by Brian Morris,which was 32ft long and took 12 passengers both boats were full.The tourists pay Â£4.50 to fish for three hours. In the winter the boats trawl for fish such as Bass, Plaice and Skate and catch Mackerel, Bass and Whiting near the surface with nets.Watergate Bay is an exellent area for catching crabs as there are lots of rocks near the surface. In the Summer the boats are popular with tourists although they are still used for catching crabs. On the way out the sea was calm and we put out weighted lines with spinners on the end to catch Mackerel to use for bait.
